name: Securly
description:
Cloud-based web filtering for K-12 Schools | Parental controls for families | Manage screen time. Any device, anywhere.

Not only a pioneer, Securly is also one of fastest-growing EdTech companies in Silicon Valley. Maybe even the world. Our ground-breaking tech allows schools and parents to keep kids safe in what is an increasingly digital world. Our goal is not to censor the Internet, but to mitigate the negative effects it can have on children. To us, a safer world for kids is a goal worth having.

Our cloud-based web filter keeps students safe, parents in the loop, and school costs down. On top of this, we are paving the way with an AI that alerts parents and counselors to instances of cyberbullying or even self-harm. Our tech can literally save lives. Pretty cool, right? Not many tech companies can say that. 

From the coders to the engineers to the interns, everyone at Securly is motivated to make the Internet safer for millions of kids and, as a result, make them better digital citizens. That said, we’re always on the lookout for like-minded people to help us expand our ranks. 

Securly was founded by two network security veterans with a combined 20+ years of security experience. We proudly serve over 1000 school districts and more than 2M students and staff throughout the world.

Securly is a trailblazing EdTech company based in San Jose, California. Founded by two network security veterans, it has quickly become one of the fastest-growing companies in the sector, focusing on creating safer digital environments for K-12 schools and families. Remember, the mission isn’t about censorship; it’s about protection and education—helping kids navigate the digital landscape without falling prey to its darker corners.

Securly’s primary offerings include cloud-based web filtering, parental controls, and screen time management across any device. Over 1,000 school districts and more than 2 million students benefit from its platform. Securly’s innovative technology not only guards students against online dangers but also promotes their overall digital well-being. Its AI-driven systems can alert parents and counselors when a child might be experiencing cyberbullying or engaging in self-harm. In fact, Securly reports that its technology has saved over 2,000 student lives—pretty remarkable for a tech company, don’t you think?

The team at Securly, now numbering 51 members, is united by a passionate commitment to making the internet a safer space for kids. They offer a variety of solutions, including Aware for wellness monitoring, Classroom for classroom management, Filter for web filtering, and even Discern, an AI tool designed to enhance student support.

Having emerged from Y Combinator’s Batch IK12, Securly is not just an EdTech player; it’s part of a vital conversation about student safety in this increasingly digital world. If you're interested in how Securly can help your school or family, their resources and support are just a click away on [securly.com](http://www.securly.com).

In summary, Securly represents not just innovation in technology, but a vision—transforming how we think about online safety in education. Its solutions are a testament to the belief that every child deserves a secure and supportive learning environment.
